author: Staff Reporter
text:
Periyanaickenpalayam police are on the lookout for Balasubramanian, a driver, on charges of stealing 17 sovereigns of jewellery from the house of V. Mahendran on Palamalai Road on Monday. The police said that the incident happened around noon when Mr. Mahendran was at a hospital on Mettupalayam Road for his mother’s regular check-up. He had reached the hospital in his car by engaging Balasubramanian to act as driver for a day. Soon after dropping Mahendran and his mother at the hospital, Balasubramanian went back to Mr. Mahendran’s home, opened the door using the key kept in the car’s dashboard, accessed the safe, stole the jewellery and retuned to the parking lot before the son-mother could return. He then dropped them at their home, parked the car and left home.

Later that evening when Mr. Mahendran checked his safe, he realised that the jewellery was missing and made inquiries with his neighbour, one of whom told him about the quick visit of the driver. Based on the information, Mahendran lodged a complaint with the police. Search is on for Balasubramanian.

Two killed in

different accidents

M. Sridhar (27) of Vellore district was killed in an accident involving a lorry and his motorcycle on the Pappampatty-Sulur main road on Monday. C. Gunasekaran (44) of Vellamadai was killed on the spot in an accident involving his motorcycle and a TNSTC bus.
title: Jewellery stolen: search on for driver
